p: Insect cellular immunity is considered as the main system challenging natural enemies entering the insect body [ 52]. The immunocytes provide the insect ability to combat invading organisms by several means including phagocytosis, nodulation, and encapsulation [ 53]. So, the reduced immunocytes, as shown for G. pyloalis larvae treated with A. annua essential oil in the present study, could cause larvae to become susceptible to any invasion [ 54, 55]. The reduced number of hemocytes is mostly due to cytotoxic effect of the botanicals used [ 56]. We do believe this toxic effect of botanicals to be more reliable as a reasoning for the reduction of immunocytes [ 57, 58, 59].
